qas.question: What was there a long pattern of from the island starting during the post Napoleonic period?
When did the population of the island start to steadily decline?
What was a big factor in emmigration to the UK?

context: During periods of unemployment, there has been a long pattern of <a0_0>emigration<a0_0/> from the island since the post-Napoleonic period. The majority of "Saints" emigrated to the UK, South Africa and in the early years, Australia. The population has steadily declined since the <a1_0>late 1980s<a1_0/> and has dropped from 5,157 at the 1998 census to 4,255 in 2008. In the past emigration was characterised by young unaccompanied persons leaving to work on long-term contracts on Ascension and the Falkland Islands, but since "Saints" were re-awarded UK citizenship in 2002, emigration to the UK by a wider range of wage-earners has accelerated due to the <a2_0>prospect of higher wages<a2_0/> and better progression prospects.
